posts.title: Fahrenheit 451 [+commentary]
posts.excerpt: Quote: In a futuristic town, Guy Montag (played by Oskar Werner) works as a fireman but with an ironic twist: his job is to create bonfires of books, which have been banned. Montag is content with his life until several encounters lead him to hide books himself and, eventually, become a fugitive from the state. …

posts._title: Radoslav Spassov – Otkradnati ochi aka Stolen Eyes (2005)
posts.title: Otkradnati ochi
posts.excerpt: Quote: This is a story of strange, impossible, inexplicable love between a Muslim Turk woman and a non-Muslim Bulgarian man. Ivan (the Bulgarian) is a pure and romantic young fellow, who gets caught up in the so-called “regeneration process” (when ethnic Turks’ names were forcibly changed to Bulgarian ones). He is responsible for the official …

posts._title: Djibril Diop Mambéty – Touki Bouki AKA Journey of the Hyena (1973)
posts.title: Touki Bouki
posts.excerpt: Quote: This 1973 first feature by Senegalese director Djibril Diop Mambety is one of the greatest of all African films and almost certainly the most experimental. Beautifully shot and strikingly conceived, it follows the comic misadventures of a young motorcyclist and former herdsman (Magaye Niang) who gets involved in petty crimes in Dakar during an …

posts.title: Phantom Power
posts.excerpt: It is not yet on IMDb. Not much info about this movie on the web, but this is a good summary: Created at irregular intervals, Pierre Léon’s small oeuvre oscillates between experimental home movie and theatrical mise-en-scène, found footage and documentary assemblages. PHANTOM POWER is a kind of sum of these rich and lavish efforts, …

posts._title: Liliana Cavani – Interno Berlinese AKA The Berlin Affair (1985)
posts.title: Interno Berlinese
posts.excerpt: Review I In 1938 Berlin, Gudrun Landgrebe, wife of Nazi functionary Kevin McNally, begins taking art lessons. She makes the acquaintance of another student, Japanese ambassador’s daughter Mio Takaki. Soon afterwards, the two women begin a passionate lesbian affair. This leads to a chain reaction of disaster and tragedy, culminating with the inevitable intervention of …

posts._title: Arnaud Desplechin – La forêt AKA The Forest (2014)
posts.title: La forêt
posts.excerpt: Based on the play by the russian playwright Alexander Ostrovsky. The film adaptation of the Comédie-Française theatre’s spectacle with their actors. A “vibrantly spontaneous and brutally funny family drama, and a glorious tribute to acting and theater,” according to the Film Society.

posts._title: Midi Z – Bing Du aka Ice Poison (2014)
posts.title: Bing Du
posts.excerpt: Faced with diminishing returns on his harvest, a poor young farmer in Myanmar pawns his cow for a moped and seeks alternative income as a taxi driver. Among his first fares is a woman who has returned home for her grandfather’s funeral and is making a new start after escaping an arranged marriage in China. …

posts.title: Crust
posts.excerpt: Quote: Guy Hands, chief executive of U.K. buyout firm Terra Firma, lost nearly $34 million as a result of investments in films including the bizarre tale of a seven-foot boxing shrimp. Hands is one of 75 investors who were encouraged to invest in a number of films through a company called Little Wing Films, claim …

posts.title: Disengagement
posts.excerpt: Plot: A political drama centered around Israel’s pullout from the occupied Gaza strip, in which a French woman of Israeli origin (Binoche) returns to the West Bank

posts._title: John Cassavetes – A Woman Under the Influence [+Extras] (1974)
posts.title: A Woman Under the Influence
posts.excerpt: ‘A Woman Under Influence’ Stars Gena Rowlands as Frenetic Wife:The Cast When a husband and wife need to keep saying how much they love each other, something’s apt to be awfully wrong. That nervous repetition is one of the danger signals in John Cassavetes’s “A Woman Under the Influence,” and it contains all the warning …
